A '''[[Tea party (social gathering)|tea party]]''' is a formal, ritualized gathering for afternoon tea. It may also refer to:
==United States politics == * One of several political protests by American colonists early in United States history, in response to Britain's [[Tea Act]]: ** [[Boston Tea Party]] (December 16, 1773; Boston, Massachusetts) ** [[Chestertown Tea Party]] (May 1774; Chestertown, Maryland) ** [[Edenton Tea Party]] (Edenton, North Carolina) * [[Boston Tea Party (political party)]], a U.S. political party named after the Boston Tea Party of 1773 * [[Tea Party movement]], an American political movement ** [[Tea Party protests]], events organized by members across the country, beginning in 2009 ** [[Tea Party Caucus]], a U.S. Congressional caucus founded in 2011 ** [[Tea Party (ballot line)]], a New York ballot line that most famously ran [[Jack Davis (industrialist)|Jack Davis]] in the [[New York's 26th congressional district special election, 2011]]
== Entertainment == * [[Tea Party (play)|''Tea Party'' (play)]], a play written by Harold Pinter, adapted from his own 1963 short story of the same title * [[The Tea Party (band)]], a Canadian rock band * [[Tea Party (song)|"Tea Party" (song)]], a song by Estonian recording artist Kerli from the album ''Almost Alice'' * "A Mad Tea Party", the seventh chapter of the novel ''[[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]]''
== See also == *[[Boston Tea Party (disambiguation)]]
